Responsibilities: Analyze legacy applications code and learn the legacy applications functionalities
Maintain existing applications, and provide support to users
Design new applications independently and/or work with architects
Provide vision for new applications from functionalities, to front end UI design
Interact with end users, and Government Lead, managers to understand new application requirements and support needs
Reverse engineer the legacy application if necessary
Use customers systems to maintain code
Requirements: 5+ years of software engineering experience including a proven history of building consumer web applications or services both front and backend components
2+ years of experience supporting a Federal client
Expert in Python (Django) and responsive front-end design (Bootstrap, Foundation, etc.)
Proficiency with databases Oracle, MySQL, SQL Server (MSSQL)
Bachelor's Degree is required for the role (preferably in a related field)
NiceToHaves: Strong communication skills both written and verbal
Excellent customer service and client facing skills including ability to present and interact regularly with clients
Benefits: Quadrant is an affirmative action/equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, status as a protected veteran, or status as an individual with a disability.
Healthcare benefits are offered to all eligible employees according to compliance mandated by the Affordable Care Act.
